text: Sir James Spaight (1818 – 21 January 1892) was an Irish Conservative politician. ==Family== Spaight was the second son of Francis Spaight — the owner of the ill-fated Francis Spaight ship - and Agnes Paterson, daughter of James Campbell Paterson. He married Elizabeth Alason Eckford, daughter of John Eckford, in 1850. He was the President of the Limerick Chamber from 1871–92, his father Francis was President from 1847–61. He was the vice-president of the Limerick Protestant Young Mens Association. ==Political career== He was a subscriber and council member and then, in 1869, president of the Athenaeum. In 1853, he was High Sheriff of Limerick City and later, in 1856, 1877 and 1883, he was Mayor of Limerick. From 1871 to his death, he was president of the Limerick Chamber of Commerce. At some point, he was also a Justice of the Peace and Deputy Lieutenant for County Tipperary. Spaight was elected unopposed as MP for Limerick City at a by-election in May 1858 but lost the seat at the next general election in 1859. He attempted to regain the seat on multiple occasions — in 1865, 1874, 1879, 1880, 1883 and 1885 — but was each time unsuccessful. Spaight was knighted in 1887. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1818 births Category:1892 deaths Category:UK MPs 1857–1859 Category:Mayors of Limerick (city) Category:Deputy Lieutenants of Tipperary Category:Deputy Lieutenants in Ireland Category:High Sheriffs of Limerick City Category:Irish Conservative Party MPs Category:Irish justices of the peace Category:Irish knights Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for County Limerick constituencies (1801–1922) Category:Politicians awarded knighthoods
title: James Spaight (MP)
